1. Acute kidney injury (AKI)

Acute kidney injury (AKI) is a condition characterized by the sudden loss of kidney function, which can lead to the buildup of waste products in the body and make it difficult for the body to regulate fluid and electrolyte levels. In the paragraph, it is mentioned as a condition that is associated with increased requirements for transplant procedures and may necessitate the use of intraoperative dialysis.
